title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 53/89 of 11 January 1989 suspending the preferential customs duties and re- introducing the common customs tariff duty on imports of large-flowered roses originating in Morocco
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 53/89
of 11 January 1989
suspending the preferential customs duties and re-introducing the Common Customs Tariff duty on imports of large-flowered roses originating in Morocco
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: For imports of large-flowered roses (CN code ex 0603 10 51), originating in Morocco, the preferential customs duty fixed by Council Regulation (EEC) No 3552/88 is hereby suspended and the Common Customs Tariff duty is hereby re-introduced from 13 January 1989.

This Regulation shall enter into force on 13 January 1989.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
